description:
Everyone has a part of themselves they cannot show to anyone else.

At a time when all nations of the world were involved in a fierce war of information happening behind closed doors, Ostania and Westalis had been in a state of cold war against one another for decades. The Westalis Intelligence Services' Eastern-Focused Division (WISE) sends their most talented spy, "Twilight," on a top-secret mission to investigate the movements of Donovan Desmond, the chairman of Ostania's National Unity Party, who is threatening peace efforts between the two nations.

This mission is known as "Operation Strix." It consists of "putting together a family in one week in order to infiltrate social gatherings organized by the elite school that Desmond's son attends."

"Twilight" takes on the identity of psychiatrist Loid Forger and starts looking for family members. But Anya, the daughter he adopts, turns out to have the ability to read people's minds, while his wife, Yor, is an assassin! With it being in each of their own interests to keep these facts hidden, they start living together while concealing their true identities from one another.
World peace is now in the hands of this brand-new family as they embark on an adventure full of surprises.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Fake Relationship
tags.description: When two characters enter a fake relationship that mutually benefits one or both involved.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Parenthood
tags.description: Centers around the experience of raising a child.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/asanovic7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/asanovic7/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/asanovic7/)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). One of the founding members of [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

Married to [Reiko Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/148052/).
He formerly worked at [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/) and is currently working at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YuhoTaniuchi)

[Twitter](https://x.com/PJciDsLcfywX1BI?s=20)

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/USUI_H)

Director of the Background Art Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

Wanted to pursue a career in anime after having seen [Princess Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/) while still in high school. The art depiction of the movie's setting made her want to become a background artist. She entered the industry in 2002, and joined Studio Who, a background art studio ran by [Tsutomu Fujita](https://anilist.co/staff/147331/). Later she joined Studio Easter and worked on many of [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/)' projects, most notably making her debut as an art director on [Idolmaster](https://anilist.co/anime/10278/). She has since served as an art director on [Your Lie in April](https://anilist.co/anime/20665/), [Occultic;Nine](https://anilist.co/anime/21708/), [Horimiya](https://anilist.co/anime/124080/) among others.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/122813934)

Originating from Studio Fuga.

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
She is currently working at MADBOX.
Freelance sound effects creator.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/4379314154)

Affiliated with [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1509743123760807936)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/skm2y_1121)

Director of the Photography Department at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

After moving to Tokyo, Sakuma initially joined Azuhata Production, where he gained some experience before joining [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) in 2009. There he took part in the production of [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/), and later made his debut as director of photography on [Saint Onii-san](https://anilist.co/anime/15775/).

[Website](https://www.hoshinogen.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/gen_senden) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/iamgenhoshino/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/genhoshino.official/) | [Youtube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPKlrgZXnnb89nSeITvTdGA/)

A Japanese singer-songwriter, musician, actor, and writer.

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)

[Twitter](https://x.com/yachikyo)

Animation Producer at [Wit Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/106375291)

Animation Producer at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/).
